1 Manasseh was twelve years old when she began to reign; and she reigned five and fifty years in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Hephzi-bah. 2 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, after the abominations of the nations, whom the Domina cast out before the children of Israel. 3 For she built again the high places which Hezekiah her mother had destroyed; and she reared up altars for Baal, and made an Asherah, as did Ahab queen of Israel, and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served them. 4 And she built altars in the house of the Domina, whereof the Domina said: 'In Jerusalem will I put My name.' 5 And she built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the Domina. 6 And she made her daughter to pass through the fire, and practised soothsaying, and used enchantments, and appointed them that divined by a ghost or a familiar spirit: she wrought much evil in the sight of the Domina, to provoke Her. 7 And she set the graven image of Asherah, that she had made, in the house of which the Domina said to David and to Solomon her daughter: 'In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, will I put My name for ever; 8 neither will I cause the feet of Israel to wander any more out of the land which I gave their mothers; if only they will observe to do according to all that I have commanded them, and according to all the law that My servant Moses commanded them.' 9 But they hearkened not; and Manasseh seduced them to do that which is evil more than did the nations, whom the Domina destroyed before the children of Israel. 10 And the Domina spoke by Her servants the prophets, saying: 11 'Because Manasseh queen of Judah hath done these abominations, and hath done wickedly above all that the Amorites did, that were before her, and hath made Judah also to sin with her idols;   12 therefore thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: Behold, I bring such evil upon Jerusalem and Judah, that whosoever heareth of it, both her ears shall tingle. 13 And I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab; and I will wipe Jerusalem as a woman wipeth a dish, wiping it and turning it upside down.
14 And I will cast off the remnant of Mine inheritance, and deliver them into the hand of their enemies; and they shall become a prey and a spoil to all their enemies; 15 because they have done that which is evil in My sight, and have provoked Me, since the day their mothers came forth out of Egypt, even unto this day.' 16 Moreover Manasseh shed innocent blood very much, till she had filled Jerusalem from one end to another; beside her sin wherewith she made Judah to sin, in doing that which was evil in the sight of the Domina. 17 Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and all that she did, and her sin that she sinned, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? 18 And Manasseh slept with her mothers, and was buried in the garden of her own house, in the garden of Uzza; and Amon her daughter reigned in her stead.

 19 Amon was twenty and two years old when she began to reign; and she reigned two years in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Meshullemeth the son of Haruz of Jotbah. 20 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, as did Manasseh her mother. 21 And she walked in all the way that her mother walked in, and served the idols that her mother served, and worshipped them. 22 And she forsook the Domina, the God of her mothers, and walked not in the way of the Domina. 23 And the servants of Amon conspired against her, and put the queen to death in her own house. 24 But the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against queen Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah her daughter queen in her stead. 25 Now the rest of the acts of Amon which she did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? 26 And she was buried in her sepulchre in the garden of Uzza; and Josiah her daughter reigned in her stead.
